title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: For this chicken tikka masala recipe, the yogurt helps tenderize the chicken; the garlic, ginger, and spices in the marinade infuse it with lots of flavor.

ingredients.text: 2 lb. skinless, boneless chicken breasts, halved lengthwise
ingredients.name: lb. skinless, boneless chicken breasts, halved lengthwise

ingredients.text: 3 Tbsp. ghee (clarified butter) or vegetable oil
ingredients.name: Tbsp. ghee (clarified butter) or vegetable oil

ingredients.text: 2 dried chiles de árbol or ½ tsp. crushed red pepper flakes
ingredients.name: dried chiles de árbol or ½ tsp. crushed red pepper flakes

ingredients.text: 1 28-oz. can whole peeled tomatoes, like San Marzano
ingredients.name: oz. can whole peeled tomatoes, like San Marzano

ingredients.text: ¾ cup chopped cilantro, plus sprigs for garnish
ingredients.name: ¾ cup chopped cilantro, plus sprigs for garnish

instructions.text: Combine garlic, ginger, turmeric, garam masala, coriander, and cumin in a small bowl. Whisk yogurt, salt, and half of spice mixture in a medium bowl; add chicken and turn to coat. Cover and chill 4-6 hours. Cover and chill remaining spice mixture.

Heat ghee in a large heavy pot over medium heat. Add onion, tomato paste, cardamom, and chiles and cook, stirring often, until tomato paste has darkened and onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add remaining half of spice mixture and cook, stirring often, until bottom of pot begins to brown, about 4 minutes.

Add tomatoes with juices, crushing them with your hands as you add them. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer, stirring often and scraping up browned bits from bottom of pot, until sauce thickens, 8-10 minutes.
Add cream and chopped cilantro. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce thickens, 30-40 minutes.

Meanwhile, preheat broiler. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil and set a wire rack inside sheet. Arrange chicken on rack in a single layer. Broil until chicken starts to blacken in spots (it will not be cooked through), about 10 minutes.

Cut chicken into bite-size pieces, add to sauce, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until chicken is cooked through, 8-10 minutes. Serve with rice and cilantro sprigs.
Do Ahead: Chicken can be made 2 days ahead. Cover; chill. Reheat before serving.
